House Demands a Real Solution to the Energy Crisis - Not Just Empty Promises

July 17, 2008 | Posted in Press Releases

The U.S. House of Representatives voted on H.R. 6515 today. While the bill gave lip service to domestic drilling, it made no advances to do so, therefore, Congress rejected the measure and is holding out for an energy bill that offers the American public real relief at the pump. Death Penalty Should be on the Table for Child Rapists

July 11, 2008 | Posted in Press Releases

Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson joined his colleagues in sending a letter to the Justices of the Supreme Court regarding the opinion recently issued in Kennedy v. Louisiana. On June 25, 2008, the Court ruled that the death penalty for child rapists is unconstitutional. Second Amendment Right is for All Americans - including individuals who live in our Nation's Capitol

June 26, 2008 | Posted in Press Releases

On March 9, 2007, the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals declared the District of Columbia’s gun ban unconstitutional. Today, the U.S. Supreme Court ruled the District of Columbia’s handgun ban violates the Second Amendment. Congressman Simpson is Hosting an Open House for New Idaho Falls Office

June 25, 2008 | Posted in Press Releases

Congressman Mike Simpson will host an open house for the public to visit his new Idaho Falls office on Tuesday, July 1. Simpson and his staff will be at the event. "I’m looking forward to meeting with constituents and listening to their concerns first hand," said Simpson. Funder's Fair to Inform Public of Grant Options

June 25, 2008 | Posted in Press Releases

Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson is hosting a Funder’s Fair at the College of Southern Idaho in Twin Falls. The event will take place on Tues., Aug. 5, 2008. Registration begins at 9:30 a.m. and the last workshop ends at 5:00 p.m. The CSI cafeteria will be open for lunch or bring your own. Domestic Sources of Oil Must be Developed

June 23, 2008 | Posted in Press Releases

Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson cosponsored legislation to reduce energy prices and improve our energy independence by developing domestic sources of oil. H.R. 6107, the American Energy Independence and Price Reduction Act, would open the Coastal Plain of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge (ANWR) to drilling within 25 months. Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson, a member of the House Appropriations Subcommittee on Energy and Water Development, today announced the inclusion of $1.25 million for the City of Boise’s geothermal system expansion project as part of legislation funding the Department of Energy next year. Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson, a member of the House Appropriations Subcommittee on Energy and Water Development, today announced the inclusion of substantial increases in funding for the Idaho National Laboratory and the Idaho Cleanup Project as part of legislation funding the Department of Energy in Fiscal Year 2009.
